snippet: Five years after the Great Recession reshaped the global economy, charitable giving is making a big comeback.
abstract: Charitable giving is making a comeback in the United States, five years after the Great Recession, up 3 percent in 2013 over previous year; donations topped $335 billion in 2013, nearing the peak from before the financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: Five years after the Great Recession reshaped the global economy, charitable giving is making a big comeback.

headline.main: New Donor Generation Stimulates U.S. Giving
